results.title: All ears
results.creator_credit: Jeremy Parker, Sunny McGill, Jeane McGill, Bruce McGill and Ben McGill
results.brief_description: A short claymation about an old man whose quiet ‘memory filled’ days are rudely interrupted by a pushy salesman. As the old man contently potters around his flat faintly hearing the outside world he is bombarded by the overbearing hard-sell tactics of a salesman selling hearing aids.

results.title: World #37...previsited
results.brief_description: World #37…previsited is a 3D computer animation (created on 3D Studio 4) of a futuristic city run by warring armed robotic soldiers. The film initially navigates the viewer through the city absent of people to focus on the only visible inhabitants being the robotic soldiers who begin to march to war. The 3D Cafe (Platinum Pictures) made the original models for the mountains, trees, the colossal statue, dragon gargoyles and robot’s skirts and boots.

results.title: The Washing machine
results.brief_description: A hand-drawn 2D computer animation in response to the theme washing machine. A man is spied upon by a mischievous elephant as he walks through the hot summer landscape. The elephant proceeds to have fun with the man by skirting him and rolling him flat on the ground. Intended as a visual play on the physical differences of man and elephant.

results.title: [Washing machine: Santa]
results.brief_description: A hand-drawn 2D computer animation in response to the theme washing machine. When people co-habit there are usually differences in how we choose to live. Santa and his live-in unicorn ‘creature’ have theirs because what is one person’s washing machine is another’s Jacuzzi.

results.title: Washing machine [the cat]
results.brief_description: This humourous hand-drawn animation is in response to the theme washing machine. A meowing cat (Howard Tal van Kleef) is locked in the laundry as a disciplinary measure by its owner. The cat’s curiosity for the outside gets the better of him when a dog frightens him into a free-fall from the window ledge towards the operating washing machine. The cat has a near death experience, his important memories flash by as he falls.

results.title: Washing machine [caveman]
results.brief_description: A hand-drawn 2D computer animation in response to the theme washing machine. A caveman’s chase of a dinosaur is interrupted by his curiosity for a mysterious object in the landscape, a washing machine. He fiddles with and bashes the washing machine in an attempt to work out what it is and discovers its’ function, a ‘drinking fountain’ (pre-historic term unknown).

results.title: Washing machine circa 1522
results.brief_description: A hand-drawn animation on paper in sepia tone in response to the theme washing machine and metamorphosis. Martin Luther (1483-1546) is a monk but also religious reformer and inventor. As he is working hard on an invention when he is attacked by a ‘Japanese’ insect. The affected monk slips into various states of metamorphosis whilst wrestling with inventing the washing machine. A tool of the Devil.

results.title: Twinkle twinkle
results.brief_description: A colour hand-drawn animation in response to the theme washing machine depicts the story of a little girl Emily in the home of arguing parents. She reads, plays and sings in a make-shift cubby house - a box that held the new washing machine - and lives a fantasy life to escape her arguing parents.

results.title: Thou shalt not...kill
results.brief_description: Thou Shalt Not Kill is a black and white cut-out animation. A priest and larrikan ride together as passengers on a train through the countryside. The larrikans’ pranks and vibrant antics play on the priests patience to test his self-control and moral beliefs…especially the one about ‘Thou Shalt Not Kill’.
